column4: Because Ubuntu is so well made and really does have for the most part a "it just works" thing goin on, people seem to be gettin scared to poke around the manually. Kinda sad.

Kinda off-topic, but yeah, if you're interested in compiling your own kernel maybe you ought to use distros that lend themselves to that kind of model. It'd be harder on Ubuntu because it's not really made with that kind of user in mind.

I agree with that. i.e. the obvious; gentoo. Truely a great way to learn debuging skills, similair to slackware being great to learn 'standard' linux philosophy. but Ubuntu has gone through a lot of work to allow for customization, including kernels. Just I feel it is sometimes a neglected featureset.
